title: The ExactMed functions
text: document aims illustrate usage functions exactmed(), exactmed_c() exactmed_cat(), well behavior via additional examples. functions compute natural direct indirect effects, controlled direct effects binary outcome. However function handles specific type mediator: exactmed() accommodates binary mediator, exactmed_c() continuous mediator exactmed_cat() categorical mediator. Details use function exact_med() provided next. Usage exactmed_c() exactmed_cat()similar exactmed(), differs aspects described thereafter. exactmed(), user can specify high levels outcome mediator variables using input parameters hvalue_m hvalue_y, respectively (see function help). Controlled direct effects obtained possible mediator values (\(m=0\) \(m=1\)). Natural controlled effects can either unadjusted (crude) adjusted covariates (, conditional effects). default, adjusted effect estimates obtained covariates fixed sample-specific mean values (numerical covariates categorical covariates associated dummies). Alternatively, adjusted effect estimates can obtained specific values covariates user-provided. Also, default, exactmed() incorporates mediator-exposure interaction term outcome model, can removed setting interaction=FALSE. Concerning interval estimates, exactmed() generates, default, \(95\%\) confidence intervals obtained delta method. Alternatively, bootstrap confidence intervals, instead delta method confidence intervals, can obtained specifying boot=TRUE function call. case, 1000 bootstrap datasets generated default. exactmed_c() exactmed_cat(), high level outcome variable can specified (using input parameter hvalue_y). Moreover, controlled direct effect computed mediator value level specified user using parameter mf. default, parameter fixed sample-specific mean mediator exactmed_c(), whereas fixed reference level mediator exactmed_cat(). order use exactmed_cat(), mediator must coded factor variable data set. default, reference level mediator first level corresponding factor variable. extra input parameter blevel_mof exactmed_cat()function allows user change default reference level level. worth noting parameterblevel_m potentially impacts value controlled direct effect (natural direct indirect effects). Due similarity exactmed(), exactmed_c()exactmed_cat()terms use options offered user, examples presented exactmed()function. exactmed()examples presented use dataset datamed, available loading ExactMed package. features dataset can found corresponding help file (help(datamed)). user interested exactmed_c()exactmed_cat()functions continuous categorical mediator cases, respectively, need change name function (dataset) calling examples understand use. datasets datamed_cand datamed_cat, feature continuous categorical mediator, respectively, presented end document along calling examples. title: The ExactMed functions
text: Suppose one wishes obtain unadjusted (crude) mediation effects estimates change exposure \(0\) \(1\), assuming exposure-mediator interaction using delta method construct \(95\%\) confidence intervals. case, valid call exactmed() : Mediation effects estimates adjusted covariates obtained use character vectors m_cov y_cov, contain names covariates adjusted mediator outcome models, respectively. following call exactmed() incorporates covariates C1 C2 mediator outcome models: exactmed() function also allows specification two different sets covariates mediator outcome models. example, following specification m_cov y_cov means mediator model adjusted C1 C2, outcome model adjusted C1 . However, advise practice unless known excluded covariates independent dependent variable (mediator outcome) modeled given rest covariates. default, adjusted parameter TRUE. adjusted parameter set FALSE, exactmed() ignores values vectors m_cov y_cov computes unadjusted (crude) effects estimates first example : perform adjusted mediation analysis allowing exposure-mediator interaction (default, interaction parameter TRUE) using bootstrap based \(100\) resamples initial random seed \(= 1991\) construct \(97\%\) confidence intervals, one call exactmed() follows:

title: The ExactMed functions
text: exactmed() function also allows categorical covariates. Covariates type must appear data frame factor, character logical columns. illustrate exactmed() works categorical covariates, replace covariate C1 dataset datamed random factor column: possible estimate mediation effects specific values categorical covariates using input parameters m_cov_cond y_cov_cond. Note targeted covariates numerical categorical, parameters require list-type vectors, instead atomic vectors covariates numerical. Hence, one wants estimate mediation effects level ‘’ C1 value \(0.4\) C2, assuming exposure-mediator interaction using delta method construct \(95\%\) confidence intervals, exactmed() called follows: one specify value categorical covariate C1, exactmed() computes effects assigning dummy variable, created internally exactmed() non-reference level C1, value equal proportion observations corresponding category (equivalent setting dummy variable mean value):

title: The ExactMed functions
text: exactmed() can also compute mediation effects binary outcome binary mediator data come classical case-control study wherein probability selected depends outcome status. , true outcome prevalence (, population prevalence \(P(Y = hvalue\_y))\) must known yprevalence parameter set value. exactmed() accounts ascertainment sample employing weighted regression techniques use inverse-probability weighting (IPW) robust standard errors (see details documentation). following call exactmed() returns mediation effects supposing data obtained case-control study true outcome prevalence \(0.1\): note, optional parameters described previous sections available case-control study context.

what: Mediation analysis with a continuous mediator
title: The ExactMed functions
text: mentioned introduction, case continuous mediator, ExactMed package allows user obtain estimates different mediation effects means exactmed_c() function, essentially offers options exactmed(). difference absence hvalue_m parameter addition mf parameter, latter allowing set value mediator calculation controlled direct effect (default fixed sample-specific mean mediator). illustration, package also makes available user datamed_c dataset containing continuous mediator variable. features dataset can found corresponding help file (help(datamed_c)). recall exactmed_c() function works data frames named columns missing values. Example call exactmed_c() order obtain estimates conditional effects supposing exposure-mediator interaction outcome regression model. perform adjusted mediation analysis allowing exposure-mediator interaction, using bootstrap based \(100\) resamples initial random seed \(= 1885\) construct \(95\%\) confidence intervals computing controlled direct effect value \(2\) mediator, one call exactmed_c() follows:

what: Mediation analysis with a categorical mediator
title: The ExactMed functions
text: mentioned introduction, case categorical mediator (coded factor), ExactMed package allows user obtain estimates different mediation effects exactmed_cat() function, essentially offers options exactmed(). difference absence hvalue_m parameter addition two extra parameters: blevel_m mf. first one allows set reference level mediator, default corresponds first level corresponding factor variable. second one allows specify level mediator calculation controlled direct effect. Parameter blevel_m thus impact mediator regression model associated output fixing reference level dependent variable. Parameter blevel_m impact value natural effects impact controlled direct effect value parameter mf specified user. case, value parameter mf default correspond value parameter blevel_m. illustration, package also makes available user datamed_cat dataset containing categorical mediator variable. features dataset can found corresponding help file (help(datamed_cat)). recall exactmed_cat() function works data frames named columns missing values. Example call exactmed_cat() order obtain estimates conditional effects supposing exposure-mediator interaction outcome regression model. perform adjusted mediation analysis allowing exposure-mediator interaction, using bootstrap based \(100\) resamples initial random seed \(= 1875\) construct \(95\%\) confidence intervals computing controlled direct effect level “c” mediator, one call exactmed_cat() follows: One can note previous output reference level mediator default first level mediator factor variable (blevel_m = '').

what: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Binary Mediator) — exactmed
title: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Binary Mediator) — exactmed
text: Relying regression-based approach, exactmed() function calculates standard     causal mediation effects outcome mediator binary. precisely, exactmed()     uses logistic regression specification outcome mediator order compute exact     conditional natural direct indirect effects (see details Samoilenko Lefebvre, 2021).     function returns point interval estimates conditional natural effects without making assumption     regarding rareness commonness outcome (hence term exact). completeness, exactmed() also     calculates conditional controlled direct effects values mediator. Natural controlled effects     estimates reported using three different scales: odds ratio (), risk ratio (RR) risk difference (RD).     interval estimates can obtained either delta method bootstrap.

title: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Binary Mediator) — exactmed
code: exactmed(   data,   a,   m,   y,   a1,   a0,   m_cov = NULL,   y_cov = NULL,   m_cov_cond = NULL,   y_cov_cond = NULL,   adjusted = TRUE,   interaction = TRUE,   Firth = FALSE,   boot = FALSE,   nboot = 1000,   bootseed = 1991,   confcoef = 0.95,   hvalue_m = NULL,   hvalue_y = NULL,   yprevalence = NULL )

title: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Binary Mediator) — exactmed
text: data named data frame includes exposure, mediator outcome variables well covariates adjusted models. exposure can either binary continuous. covariate categorical, included data frame factor, character logical variable. name binary continuous exposure variable. m name binary mediator variable. y name binary outcome variable. a1 value corresponding high level exposure. a0 value corresponding low level exposure. m_cov vector containing names adjustment variables (covariates) mediator model. y_cov vector containing names adjustment variables (covariates) outcome model. m_cov_cond named vector (atomic vector list) containing specific values adjustment covariates m_cov mediator model. Please consult package vignette details. y_cov_cond named vector (atomic vector list) containing specific values adjustment covariates y_cov outcome model. Please consult package vignette details. adjusted logical variable specifying whether obtain adjusted unadjusted estimates. adjusted = FALSE, vectors m_cov y_cov ignored procedure. interaction logical variable specifying whether exposure-mediator interaction term outcome model. Firth logical variable specifying whether compute conventional penalized maximum likelihood estimates logistic regression models (see details). boot logical value specifying whether confidence intervals obtained delta method percentile bootstrap. nboot number bootstrap replications used obtain confidence intervals boot = TRUE. bootseed value initial seed (positive integer) random number generation boot = TRUE. confcoef number 0 1 confidence coefficient (ex.: 0.95) interval estimates. hvalue_m value corresponding high level mediator. mediator already coded numerical binary variable taking 0 1 values, default hvalue_m = 1. hvalue_y value corresponding high level outcome. outcome already coded numerical binary variable taking 0 1 values, default hvalue_y = 1. yprevalence prevalence outcome population (number 0 1). Option used case-control data used. low level outcome treated control level.

title: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Binary Mediator) — exactmed
text: object class results returned: ne.Natural effects estimates scale. ne.rr Natural effects estimates RR scale. ne.rd Natural effects estimates RD scale. cdem0 Controlled direct effect (m=0) estimates. cdem1 Controlled direct effect (m=1) estimates. med.reg Summary mediator regression. .reg Summary outcome regression. boot==TRUE, returned object also contains: boot.ne.Bootstrap replications natural effects scale. boot.ne.rr Bootstrap replications natural effects RR scale. boot.ne.rd Bootstrap replications natural effects RD scale. boot.cdem0.Bootstrap replications controlled direct effect (m=0) scale. boot.cdem0.rr Bootstrap replications controlled direct effect (m=0) RR scale. boot.cdem0.rd Bootstrap replications controlled direct effect (m=0) RD scale. boot.cdem1.Bootstrap replications controlled direct effect (m=1) scale. boot.cdem1.rr Bootstrap replications controlled direct effect (m=1) RR scale. boot.cdem1.rd Bootstrap replications controlled direct effect (m=1) RD scale. boot.ind Indices observations sampled bootstrap replication (one replication per column).

title: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Binary Mediator) — exactmed
text: default, exactmed() reports mediation effects evaluated sample-specific mean values numerical covariates     (including dummy variables created internally function represent non-reference levels categorical covariates).     order estimate mediation effects specific values covariates (, stratum-specific effects),     user needs provide named vectors m_cov_cond /y_cov_cond containing values levels. adjustment     covariates appearing m_cov y_cov (common adjustment covariates) must values; otherwise,     exactmed()'s execution aborted error message displayed R console. Firth parameter allows reduce bias regression coefficients estimators facing problem     separation quasi-separation. bias reduction achieved brglmFit fitting method brglm2 package.     precisely, estimates obtained using penalized maximum likelihood Jeffreys prior penalty, equivalent mean     bias-reducing adjusted score equation approach Firth (1993). data come case-control study, yprevalence parameter used value ideally correspond true outcome prevalence.     exactmed() accounts ascertainment sample employing weighted regression techniques use inverse probability weighting (IPW)     robust standard errors. errors obtained via vcovHC function R package sandwich.     Specifically, use HC3 type covariance matrix estimator (default type vcovHC function).

what: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Continuous Mediator) — exactmed_c
title: Exact Mediation Effects Computation (Continuous Mediator) — exactmed_c
text: Relying regression-based approach, exactmed_c() function calculates standard     causal mediation effects outcome binary mediator continuous. precisely, exactmed_c()     relies logistic linear models outcome mediator, respectively, order compute exact     conditional natural direct indirect effects.     Nested counterfactual probabilities underlying definition natural effects calculated using numerical integration.     function returns point interval estimates conditional natural effects without making assumption     regarding rareness commonness outcome (hence term exact). completeness, exactmed_c() also     calculates conditional controlled direct effect specified value mediator. Natural controlled effects     estimates reported using three different scales: odds ratio (), risk ratio (RR) risk difference (RD).     interval estimates can obtained either delta method bootstrap.
